page.title: 04 EVENTS AND CUSTOMS
page.content: This year,Launceston was{twinned}with Plestin_les_Greves in Brittany.The square was the scene of a Victorian Street Market to welcome the Bretons. On March 31st dignitaries from both towns,led by their uniformed bands, paraded to the Town Hall for the official twinning.Every year,the mayor is elected to take office in May at a special ceremony in the Town Hall.Two weeks later local organisations parade with the Mayor to the Church of his or her choice.When{Beating the Bounds}, energetic townsfolk walk around the borough boundary for 13 miles.The Duke of Cornwall comes to receive the { {Fuedal Dues}in the Castle precinct.A few are an ashen faggot,pepper and spurs.A November evening{Carnival}is a colourful lighted procession of walking guys,tableaux on lorries and our carnival queen and village queens.
